list.name: Clusterleaves of Cultivation and Four-Leaf Sigils...
Energy Block inside the Ruin Golem...
Lens capable of detecting The Withering
Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar, II
Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar, III
Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar, I
Runic Window and Runic Pane Switch
Sandstorm in the Desert of Hadravameth...
Dual-Phase Neverlight Cells and Dual-Phase Everlight Cells
Mysterious Floating Stones Within the Defiled Chambers...
The Purple Mist in the Swamp...
Bubble Formation, but It's Not Evil This Time!
The Resilience and Vitality of Fontemer Seagrass...
Pneuma, Ousia, and Their Mutual Annihilation
Abilities of the Transoceanic Sourcewater and Xenochromatic Creatures
Bond of Life and Recovering HP
Fixed Storage Device and Energy Transfer Device
You Don't Need That Much Water...
Arkhe - Pneuma & Ousia
list.desc: A useful Fontainian mechanism for both exploration and combat that uses two opposing forces: Pneuma and Ousia

list.name: A Machine With Xenochromatic Ball Octopus Abilities?
Floating Crystal Flowers and Floating Crystal Platforms
Operable Mechanism: Track Assemblages and Eliphas Beams
Operable Mechanism: Vertical Lifting Columns and Eliphas Beams
The Abilities of the Xenochromatic Ball Octopus
The Tower of Ipsissimus's Optical Couplers
Character Overview Guide
list.desc:
The building guides for this Event Wish's drop-boosted characters are out! Let's take a look together~

The guides contain the characters' basic information, equipment tips, material harvest routes, and everything else you need to turn them into absolute powerhouses!

list.name: "Millennia of History Have Their Eyes on Us!"
Elemental Reactions
list.desc:
Elemental Reactions represent the centerpiece of the combat system of Genshin Impact. Understanding and mastering these interactions can drastically improve one’s proficiency in battle.

There are multiple factors to consider when triggering Elemental Reactions, such as aura, trigger, decay, etc. Elemental Gauge Theory and Internal Cooldowns will play a major role to help players understand the complexity behind Elemental Reactions.

list.name: Elemental Resonance
list.desc: Elemental Resonance provides additional effects that correspond to the elements present in the party.

list.name: Energy Recharge
list.desc: Energy Recharge (ER%) is a percentage statistic that determines how much Energy a character regains by receiving the same amount of particles.

list.name: Energy
list.desc: Elemental Energy is a resource that allows each character to activate their Elemental Burst after acquiring a specific amount.

list.name: Bond of Life
list.desc: Bond of Life is a long-lasting status applied to a character that requires a certain amount of healing before allowing HP regeneration (max. 200% of the Max HP).

list.name: Damage Formula
list.desc: The Damage Formula is a calculation of all the elements that damage involves. It's a complex operation that requires the consideration of many things.

list.name: Swaying Eels in the Coral Reefs
A Mysterious Bookshelf Full of Grimoires?
Spiral Abyss
list.desc: The Spiral Abyss is a permanent domain with challenges constantly updated on the 16th of each month. It is unlocked at Adventure Rank 20.

list.name: Imaginarium Theater
list.desc:
The Imaginarium Theater is a permanent domain with challenges constantly updated on the 1st of each month. It is unlocked at Adventure Rank 35.

Before the beginning of all stories, after the end of all tales, in the interstice between reality and fantasy, there is an endless drama unfolding, never ceasing upon the stage – There is no beginning, nor an end, for in the telling of the "story," the two differ not.

list.name: Envisaged Echoes
list.desc: Envisaged Echoes is a high difficulty permanent challenge gameplay constantly updated each season and rewards character's Echo cosmetic. It is unlocked after completing Act 6 of Imaginarium Theater at Adventure Rank 35.

list.name: O Nightsoul, inscribe your shadow in this place...
Humans and Saurians, one heart and one mind!
Saurian Indwelling and Mimesis
list.desc: A Natlanese mechanism for both exploration and combat that allows the player to take the form of Saurians and their abilities.

list.name: Artifacts
list.desc: Artifacts are equipment items that increase the character stats and activate some special effects when certain conditions are reached.

list.name: Altar of Primal Flame on the Tonatiuh?
Solid Phlogiston in the Flying Area
Stygian Onslaught
list.desc:
Stygian Onslaught is a permanent combat event with challenges regularly updated 8 days after each version update and runs for 5 weeks per phase. It is unlocked at Adventure Rank 20.

A strange Ley Line Disturbance has once again appeared, this time in Liyue's Sal Terrae. You must breach the depths of this unpredictable Domain, for only by defeating powerful foes can the turmoil be quelled... Of course, where danger awaits, so too do extraordinary treasures...

list.name: Genius Invokation TCG
list.desc: Genius Invokation TCG is Genshin Impact's official card game, available as a permanent in-game mode that is unlocked at Adventure Rank 32.

list.name: Saurian Staff Test Run: Cruise Ship
Kuuvahki
list.desc: Kuuvahki is a type of native Nod-Krai magnetism-like energy, polarized not by positive and negative, but by red and blue.

list.name: Elemental Reaction: Lunar-Bloom
list.desc:
When Dendro meets Hydro, and certain other conditions are met, a special Lunar-Bloom reaction occurs. In addition to the standard Bloom reaction effects, this also provides the party with valuable "Verdant Dew."
Certain characters can consume "Verdant Dew" or utilize their Talents to deal Lunar-Bloom DMG to enemies. This DMG can trigger CRIT Hits.

list.name: Moonsign
list.desc:
When Moonsign characters are in the party, the party will attain a Moonsign Level corresponding to the number of such characters.
As your party's Moonsign Level increases, some of the Moonsign characters' skills will be enhanced, as well as the effects of some Weapons and Artifacts. Other characters can also provide buffs to the party.
Furthermore, in Nod-Krai, where the new moon rises, there appear to be other ways to increase your party's Moonsign Level...

list.name: Verdant Dew
list.desc:
Within 2.5s after party members trigger Lunar-Bloom reactions, your party will receive 1 Verdant Dew every 2.5s.
Your party can have up to 3 Verdant Dew. If you trigger another Lunar-Bloom reaction during this time, the duration of this effect will be reset.

list.name: Plants Affected by Kuuvahki
list.desc: In Nod-Krai, you will find special plants that can provide characters with kuuvahki energy...

list.name: Assembly Modules
list.desc: Assembly modules are objects that can carry a red or blue unipolar charge.

list.name: Bobik the Super Strong
list.desc: Bobik can generate powerful Blue Unipolar Fields to easily move or rotate containers that have Red Unipolar Fields.

list.name: Amazing 'Bots
list.desc: An ingenious mechanism said to have been birthed in the Clink-Clank Krumkake Craftshop and now in use throughout the Southern Isles. Individually, they can help complete tasks, but if someone were ever to connect a few together, well, perhaps they'd be capable of bigger and better things...

list.name: Kuuvahki Dewdrops
list.desc:
It seems like strange creatures dwell within...
Throwing Kuuvahki Dewdrops on red or blue Unipolar Crystonite might cause something unexpected to happen...

list.name: Moonlanes
list.desc:
A common sight in kuuvahki-suffused Nod-Krai, said to be the traces of passing kuuhenki.
Riding the Moonlanes allows you to harness the power of kuuvahki to swiftly move along their path. However, the Moonlanes do not all flow uninterrupted, and there are times when switching paths is the wisest choice.

list.name: Clever Little Sniffer Moles
list.desc: Clever little Sniffer Moles can detect red or blue Unipolar Fields.

list.name: Watch Out for Bullets!
list.desc:
According to Auni, in order to stop the hazardous device's attacks, you must first remove its "energy core" — a Kuuvahki Relay Mechanism.
Approach the hazardous device carefully and attract the Kuuvahki Relay Mechanism to shut it down.

list.name: Hazardous Device Alert!
list.desc: The hazardous device will fire special Bipolar Projectiles from its core.

list.name: Jump Higher
list.desc: When in an <color=#FFE14BFF>empowered state</color>, characters can <color=#FFE14BFF>press Jump</color> when within <color=#FFE14BFF>same-colored</color> Unipolar Fields to perform a special jump.

list.name: Strong Kuuvahki Environment
list.desc: Certain special regions exist within Nod-Krai. When entering these regions, characters will automatically enter an empowered state.

list.name: Be Careful When Carrying Kuuvahki Relay Mechanisms
list.desc:
Carrying Kuuvahki Relay Mechanisms in lightning storms is extremely dangerous and will increase the likelihood of being struck by lightning.
However, experienced adventurers can also use special lightning strikes to overcome difficulties along their journeys...

list.name: The Different Forms of Kuuhenki
list.desc: The kuuhenki of Nod-Krai take various forms, like the contrasting yet entwined hues of Nocturnal Blossoms.

list.name: Dangerous Data Gathering
list.desc: To ensure the data collector's successful lift-off, the Assembly Modules on all three paths must be pushed to their designated locations, <color=#FFE14BFF>generating a Strong Unipolar Field oriented toward the collector</color>.

list.name: Recon Bots
list.desc: If you can destroy the control center at the <color=#FFE14BFF>top</color>, perhaps you can take it down more easily...

list.name: Rippleweeds
list.desc: A strange plant that grows in damp conditions. Throwing Kuuvahki Dewdrops on the tightly closed leaves might cause them to unfurl.

list.name: Stellafruit
list.desc: A strange, star-shaped fruit that can often be found among the Rippleweeds beside Blue Amber Lake. It seems to contain a mysterious power...

list.name: Cleaning Bots
list.desc: A small mechanical device that can be found in nearly every corner of the Kuuvahki Experimental Design Bureau. The Fatui are so used to seeing these that they hardly notice them anymore. Can be controlled by means of a console.

list.name: Of Barrier Generators and ID Cards
list.desc: A kuuvahki-powered barrier created as a result of the Kuuvahki Experimental Design Bureau's experiments.

list.name: Tideseal Stones
list.desc: A seal placed by the Lightkeepers to dispel the permeation of the Wild Hunt.

list.name: The Moon Mirror
list.desc: A legendary item claimed to have been used by the Frostmoon Scions in their ceremonies. At times, it is possible to glimpse curious scenes in the mirror's reflection...

list.name: The Moon Mirror's Different Forms
list.desc: The same object, reflected in the Moon Mirror in different forms, can take on a whole new appearance...

list.name: Atapetra Conch
list.desc: A mysterious and ancient creature with a hard shell. Perhaps bashing these shells will reward your characters with the mysterious energy to enter an empowered state...

list.name: Mysterious Mists and Viridescent Mossballs
list.desc:
By switching forms, kuuhenki can traverse the mysterious mist to arrive near the Viridescent Mossball.
But be aware, even though kuuhenki in different forms are attracted to mists of different colors, when they encounter a mist which is the same color as themselves, they will be repelled.

list.name: Empowered State and "Bipolar" Objects
list.desc: In Nod-Krai, you will find kuuvahki-influenced "Bipolar" Objects.

list.name: Empowered State and "Unipolar" Objects
list.desc: In Nod-Krai, you will find certain objects that carry a red or blue "unipolar" charge.

list.name: Same Colors Repel, Opposite Colors Attract
Traveling Around Using Patches of Mist
list.desc: Transform into kuuhenki of different forms to take refuge in mists of <color=#FFE14BFF>different colors</color>.
